text: The 2013 Big 12 Conference Women's Soccer Tournament was the postseason women's soccer tournament for the Big 12 Conference held on November 6, 8 and 10, 2014. The seven-match tournament was held at the Swope Soccer Village in Kansas City, Missouri with a combined attendance of 2,787. The 8-team single- elimination tournament consisted of three rounds based on seeding from regular season conference play. The West Virginia Mountaineers defeated the Oklahoma State Cowgirls in the championship match to win their first conference tournament since joining the league. ==Regular Season Standings== Source: {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan ="2" |Place ! rowspan ="2" |Seed ! rowspan ="2" |Team ! colspan = "5" | Conference ! colspan = "4" | Overall |- ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | W ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | L ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | T ! scope="col" style="width: 30px;" | % ! scope="col" style="width: 30px;" | Pts ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | W ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | L ! scope="col" style="width: 20px;" | T ! scope="col" style="width: 30px;" | % |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text- align:center;" | 1 | style="text-align:center;" | 1 | |7 |1 |0 | |21 |16 |4 |3 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 2 | style="text- align:center;" | 2 | |6 |0 |2 | |20 |18 |2 |3 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | style="text-align:center;" | 3 | |5 |2 |1 | |16 |12 |6 |2 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 4 | style="text-align:center;" | 4 | |3 |4 |1 | |10 |9 |9 |2 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 4 | style="text-align:center;" | 5 | |3 |4 |1 | |10 |11 |6 |3 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 6 | style="text-align:center;" | 6 | |2 |3 |3 | |9 |9 |7 |6 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 7 | style="text-align:center;" | 7 | |2 |5 |1 | |7 |6 |10 |3 | |-bgcolor=#ccffcc | style="text-align:center;" | 7 | style="text-align:center;" | 8 | |2 |5 |1 | |7 |7 |11 |2 | |- | style="text- align:center;" | 9 | style="text-align:center;" | | |1 |7 |0 | |3 |4 |13 |1 | |} ==Bracket== ==Awards== ===Most Valuable Player=== Source: *Offensive MVP – Frances Silva – West Virginia *Defensive MVP – Kadeisha Buchanan – West Virginia ===All-Tournament Team=== {| class="wikitable" !
